question.body: Which structure communicates with the sympathetic ganglia in the thoraco-lumbar region?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is sending sensory input from peripheral system to spinal cord.
Incorrect. This branch is found in all parts of the spinal cord communicating with all structures anterior to the spinal cord, not just sympathetic.
Incorrect. This branch is communicating with structures posterior to the spinal cord.
Correct. This is a small branch off the anterior ramus specific for sympathetic neural communication with sympathetic ganglia.
Incorrect. This is white matter structure inside spinal cord, not part of peripheral communication.

part.hint: This connection found only in the thoracic and part of lumbar region allows "communication" between first and second sympathetic motor neurons.
